feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 31 at 6:26AM AKDT until October 31 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 inches. Storm total snowfall since Saturday night of 8 to 18 inches, heaviest west of Tok. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway from Dot Lake east.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 31 at 4:57AM AKDT until November 01 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with near blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 50 mph. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 31 at 11:01AM PDT until November 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...First Significant Storm of the Wet Season Early This Week... A strong storm system will move out of the Gulf of Alaska Monday and move into the Pacific Northwest on Monday night. We are expecting a strong cold front to move across the region on Tuesday night. Snow is expected to increase Tuesday afternoon with the potential heavy snow on Tuesday night. The front will push south
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 11:02AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The forecast point at Astor is forecast to remain in Moderate flood stage this week while resuming a slow decline. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Moderate flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 10:57AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The forecast point at Deland is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through this week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 10:56AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to continue a slow decline and fall out of moderate flood and into minor flood stage late this week. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts through mid week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 10:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva is in Moderate Flood Stage and is forecast to continue a slow decline through Moderate Flood Stage into next week. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... entry.title: Flash Flood Watch issued October 31 at 7:57AM PDT until October 31 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rain from the Puget Sound Convergence Zone is possible over the burn scar. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BOLT CREEK BURN SCAR NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Bolt Creek burn scar.
entry.cap:areaDesc: West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 31 at 3:31AM PDT until November 02 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches in the northern Blue Mountains and 4 to 8 inches in the southern Blue Mountains. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Blue Mountains

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 30 at 7:10PM PDT until October 31 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers up to 27 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast Counties. In Washington, South Washington Coast County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: South Washington Coast

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued October 31 at 2:41AM MDT until November 02 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains and Central Carbon County including Rawlins.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued October 31 at 2:41AM MDT until November 02 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Upper North Platte River Basin and North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin

entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle North Platte River Basin, Niobrara and Converse High Plains; Niobrara, Lower Elevations of Converse, Thunder Basin National Grassland

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued October 31 at 2:09AM MDT until November 02 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTHEAST WYOMING AND MUCH OF WESTERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Increasing southwest winds ahead of a developing low pressure system, coupled with very dry air and warm temperatures, will likely support a long duration of critical fire weather conditions
